definition: have no way out/have no alternative/abbr. to 無奈|无奈[wu2 nai4]
can/may/able to/to approve/to permit/to suit/(particle used for emphasis) certainly/very

sentences.english: Take mightiness of unwilling, but again can have no option ground to fall in chips.
sentences.chinese: 似帶着強烈的不甘，卻又只能無可奈何地破碎。

sentences.english: My neighbors and I shook our heads and fumed.
sentences.chinese: 鄰居們和我一樣，憤怒地搖頭，卻無可奈何。

sentences.english: Taoists maintain a negative and helpless attitude toward man's fate.
sentences.chinese: 道家對人之命運持一種自然的無可奈何的態度。

sentences.english: Take on a victim mentality and there is nothing you can do about your life.
sentences.chinese: 保持一份受害者的心態並且堅定自己對生活無可奈何。

sentences.english: However, the "aqua regia" to titanium was no alternative.
sentences.chinese: 然而，“王水”對鈦卻無可奈何。

sentences.english: He stood there helpless, not knowing what to do.
sentences.chinese: 他無可奈何地站在那裏，不知道如何是好。

sentences.english: Love shouldn't fall in love with the people, but the helpless put not hand.
sentences.chinese: 贓羜愛着不該愛上的人，卻無可奈何的放不了手。

sentences.english: He spread out his arms and shrugged his shoulders.
sentences.chinese: 他無可奈何地攤開雙臂聳了聳肩。

sentences.english: He diddled me out of $ 50 and I can do nothing about it.
sentences.chinese: 他從我手中騙去50美元，我無可奈何。

sentences.english: The Bush administration could do little but seethe.
sentences.chinese: 布什政府對此無可奈何。

sentences.english: I know you don't believe me, " I said resignedly."
sentences.chinese: “我知道你不相信我，”我無可奈何地說。

sentences.english: Eddie noticed the 18)resigned look on the Blue Man’s face.
sentences.chinese: 愛迪注意到藍皮人臉上無可奈何的表情。

sentences.english: I mean I--at some point you just have to throw up your hands, but yes it's a good question.
sentences.chinese: 問到這地步，你也只能無可奈何了，但這是個好問題。

sentences.english: Richard's mother finds out when his brother tells on him, and the father cannot punish him.
sentences.chinese: 當哥哥向母親揭發他的惡行時，父親卻無可奈何。

sentences.english: But that does not mean that they are without countermeasures.
sentences.chinese: 但是，這種狀況並不意味着他們就無可奈何。

sentences.english: But the presumed fabulous treasure in the deeper water was beyond their reach.
sentences.chinese: 但預想當中的驚人寶藏卻在更深的水下，無可奈何。

definition: helpless/without choice/for lack of better option/grudgingly/willy-nilly/nolens volens/abbr. for 無可奈何|无可奈何[wu2 ke3 nai4 he2]
to feel embarrassed or awkward/to make things difficult (for someone)/to find things difficult (to do or manage)
to despair/to give up all hope/desperate/desperation
to grieve/to be broken-hearted/to feel deeply hurt
to feel sad/to feel unwell/(of life) to be difficult
